The lasagna came out bubbling hot, with just the perfect amount of sauce, and it almost had a sweet side to it, and both dishes were delicious.  The Tiramisu ........wow.....the fluffiness, the creaminess, the subtle hint of liquer....  We will be back!!!!

Haven't been here in a long time, but wasn't disappointed with this visit.  John was super nice to us and, per my request, moved us to a table by a window.  Our waitress, Brecken, was great .. a little over worked which slowed down service, but she did a good job.  Our busser, Austin, was did a great job and was very pleasant. He seemed to be doing a lot of different jobs as well.  The food was out-standing. My chicken piccata was great  My girlfriend ordered the Spaghetti Carbonara which she enjoyed, however, there was a tad bit too much oil in the bottom of the bowl.  We ended with the chocolate layer cake which was baked to perfection .. nothing frozen here.  Oh, and of course, the bread and the oil it comes with .... very good.    The only knocks would be the service was a little slow due to possible understaffing issues and the restaurant itself was a tad bit warm inside.    We will be making this a regular stop!

We were attracted to this restaurant because of good reviews posted elsewhere.  So my wife and I went for lunch.  My wife really liked the Pizza Bianco, and we even had enough left over for dinner that night too!  I had a sandwich and got a side of fries.  Unfortunately, the fries looked like they'd been done in oil that hadn't been hot enough as they were a little soft/soggy.  Nonetheless, I ate them and they tasted just right.  We said we'd go back and try them for dinner sometime.

On a family vacation in Scottsdale, AZ, we stumbled across this quaint little Italian restaurant that was tucked away by the airport about a block off Scottsdale Road. The reviews were good, we were hungry and with a family full of ex-New Yorkers living in Southern California, we're always up for some good New York atmosphere.  As we pulled up and walked in, someone held the door open for us... turned out to be one of the owners (I believe)... I was immediately greeted (as the last one of the bunch walking in.. and hobbling on a banged up knee from a day of tubing through rapids).. with sarcasm on how I should "take my time, they'll be open another 5 hours"..  Ahh... New York sarcasm.  I was already feeling "at home".  We sat down fairly quickly.  The restaurant had a good amount of people in it, but still had room for us with barely a wait.  We never said anything about being "from New York" but were treated quite well from the wait staff (and owners/managers) who kept checking in to be sure everything was going well.   THE FOOD: The menu was typical Italian.  Amongst the 7 of us we had Linguini in White Clam sauce, Eggplant Parmagiana, Shrimp Parmagiana, Gnocchi, a small pizza, Cavatelli w/ sausage & broccoli and Calamari Fra Diavolo (ordered by my 8 year old son).  The one thing I wanted to get but passed on was the Braciole (in mama's gravy).  That was a special, but I opted for the Linguini instead.  EVERYTHING was really good.  We didn't stay for desert since we were all tired from the long day of tubing, so I can't comment on the deserts... but we were all quite happy with our meal.  Additional Service note: We found out towards the end of our meal that our waitress was from Massapequa, NY (a town on Long Island that my wife & I lived in w/ the kids before moving to Cali).  The other owner came over.. he was from the Bronx.  We all joked around a bit and they were certainly a friendly bunch.  I observed how friendly the staff was with other guests too and they certainly appeared to make everyone feel welcome.  Always a plus.  Good food + Good, friendly service from people who appear to honestly care is alway a winner in my book.  There's a Maggiano's down the road and a couple of "NYPD"'s, but I HIGHLY recommend this place for it's authenticity.

After lots of research for the beats Italian food, we made the trip from Surprise, AZ. John, from the Bronx, was the most amazing host. He made our anniversary so special! We had the specials: seafood salad (very fresh and tasty)and lobster ravioli(with the most decadent cream sauce). He suggested a chilled Red, which was a perfect addition to our meal, especially given the hot weather. We ended with tiramisu and cheesecake, yummmm. The fresh bread was awesome too. So good we bought a gift cert for the picky New York in laws :) thanks John!
John is great. Lasagna was great. Made for a memorable evening.  A bit hard to find but worth it when you do.

Best.Bruschetta.Ever.  I came here with some co-workers for lunch and found quite a gem! I would have never found it on my own as it was tucked away, but thanks to Yelp I found it! Apparently one of my co-workers had been coming here for years but had kept the secret all to himself. The Mediterranean salad with chicken was very good, and the bruschetta was to die for! I liked the chewy bread instead of crusty, crispy kind.  The pizza bread was decent but could have been a bit saucier.  The decor is adorable. I am always so happy to find small places like this!

My husband and I tried the lunch menu recently so we knew we needed to go back and try dinner. We started out with the calamari inferno, one of their signature appetizers which was very good. I had the veal marsala and hubby had veal parmigiana. Well worth the price because the veal portions were huge. I had three big patties, very tender, and the marsala sauce was delicious. Very friendly, attentative service. As we sat and ate many regulars came through the door. It's definitely a word of mouth kind of place, because one would never see it otherwise. It's off the main road, tucked away. I see us becoming a couple of regulars ourselves.

Went here Friday night and was disappointed!  I ordered the chicken Marsala and asked to have gluten free pasta or vegetables instead of the regular pasta. Our waiter looked bored and said he couldn't do that. No explanation. Told me I'd just have to have the chicken. They have gluten free pasta on the menu!  Upset and had only the chicken breadt to eat. My husbands cod was cold. We would not recommend it here. They have a cute outdoor patio - we asked to sit there but we're told we couldn't even though the tables were empty the entire time we were there.  We won't be back or recommend it to our friends. Portion size is perfect though

We dined here for a birthday celebration.  The wait staff was excellent and they were very accommodating, I wish the seats were a little bigger and softer as I needed a pillow.  All the food was amazing, well prepared and came out in a timely fashion.. The waiter John is from the east coast and hit it off with my family members.  The antipasto was great as an app and everyone had fresh made pasta with one pizza.  the food melted in your mouth and even the bathrooms were clean.  It is right next to the Scottsdale airpark.  Great Food, Great Services, Great atmosphere and Great time .  Enjoy from one foodie to another

Been here twice, and both times made me feel like I was going to my grandparent's house for dinner. I'm Sicilian and quite finicky when it comes to Italian food, but this place is the real deal.  It was nice to witness when people walked in the door, John the manager, would greet them by name. This shows me that there are a lot of regulars (repeat costomers) and he has taken the time to get to know his patrons.  Now on to the food...  The first visit, I ordered the chicken picata. It was some of the best I've ever tasted. The second time I had the chicken marsala. Again, it was very delicious. We also tried the fried mozzarella appetizer, which was placed on a bed of prosciutto and arrugala, and drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette. Wow! For desert we had canoli and tiramisu. The canoli wasn't like my grandmother's but it was ok.  The only place almost as good as this place is Nicks, but that is a distant second.
Best place for Italian food! Friendliest waiter food was delicious ! Service impeccable !
Went in here for a quick bite for dinner. Service was prompt and courteous. I had some eggplant parm and a salad. It was the best eggplant parm I have had at a Italian restaurant in quite a while.

Four stars for lunch.  Two for dinner.  The food's great across the board.  So is the service.  I just don't notice being in 70's era surroundings at the end of a municipal runway as much when chowing down on a $15 lunch cheesesteak and soda, the way I do when forking over $30 for a bowl of pasta and glass of wine.

Brought the kids to lunch here. They have cheese pizza for $2.99 a slice. I got the pasta special with fusilli, artichoke hearts, sundried tomato and sausage. My hubby had the spaghetti with meat sauce. For dessert we had the spumoni which was coated in chocolate and delicious. Definitely a hidden gem!

I found this little gem in the middle of nowhere. Thanks to all the Yelp reviews. Let me start off by saying that this place is in the middle of a business park. We went for dinner on a Saturday night so the business park was empty except a few cars in one corner of the parking lot. The restaurant is not facing the street so I just followed the parked cars.   All I have to say about this place is wow. The decor is casual. Nothing really pops out to me but the food is great.   My wife was going wild over the hot fresh bread. I had the thin crust Margherita pizza. Very good. I really enjoyed it. My wife had the spaghetti with meat sauce and really enjoyed it. We think that they used the same sauce for the pizza and spaghetti which we're not complaining cause it was so good.   We ended our meal with their homemade Spinoni that had three flavors of chocolate, pistachio and strawberry that was dipped in a hard chocolate. This was so good. We were fight over the last few bites and of course my wife won.   The service was great. They were filling our water cups in a timely manner without us asking. The server was very friendly, helped and very pleasant. They were very grateful that we came in and everyone thanks us.   What can I say great Italian food, good service but hidden in a business park. Can't wait to bring our kids.

Great restaurant. The food was delicious. My mom went to this 3 times in one week. She loved the spaghetti carbonara.  It's not very expensive, the wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable. It's NOT a quiet restaurant, we brought a 15 month old.

We order lunch from here for our office of 12. . . we also use their catering for luncheons with clients.  No matter what is ordered, we are NEVER disappointed.  The food is exceptional and the staff is great.  Definitely worth searching out if you've never been before!

This place is a little off the beaten path of the main road but it was definitely a good find. The pricing wasn't too high and the staff is very friendly. Our waters were always full and several times someone came by to ask if we were okay.  My girlfriend got the vodka penne pasta which I tasted a couple times and it was delicious. Overall good atmosphere and service!

Unexpected find hidden in a light industrial park near the Scottsdale Airport.  Family owned and run with great, simple fare.  Authentic, home-style Italian...nothing fancy or high-brow, but very good! Great spot for a satisfying lunch...be warned, though...there is not table service; you walk-up and place your order at a counter.

Unfortunately, upon my return this week, the food was not up to par. The pizza was a huge disappointment.  The toppings were very poorly distributed, to the point where some slices of pizza did not even have all the toppings on it. I personally found the crust terrible. They claim it's a thin crust pizza, but my whole table didn't agree with that description. Service is decent, but they are all up at the front talking about you and not even hiding the fact. They are looking right at you and commenting to each other back and forth. Talk about uncomfortable.  The icing on the cake tho, was when the owner came by to ask us if everything was okay. I hate having that conversation, but I said coyly, no, not really, not our best night and he replied, and I quote, "great, that's just beautiful, beautiful!" and walked away. That was it. Never heard from anyone again. Paid the bill and we left for one last time. I'll never go back after that. The service and food would not have received only 1 star, but since the owner acted that way and did not even care to know what was wrong, let alone do something about it, they get 1 star from me, and that's only because there is no lower rating.

Came in for lunch with my son. It's order and sit for lunch. And they will bring the food out to your table.  I had lasagna and my son had spaghetti with marinara plus we share a Caesar salad. Everything are fresh and the portion is good for us. Lasagna seemed to be a very popular as people around me were all having it. I like most is the food was not loaded with salt and I could taste every ingredients. My son is a picky eater and he liked his spaghetti here. Will definitely return with hubby for dinner and try out more of the other dishes and deserts too!
Great food! Pastas are incredible - everyone in our party gave it 5 stars. The desert is also great. Servers are real, and I really enjoyed this Italian nook.
As advertised.  I have worked in the scot airpark area for over 20 years.  Finally stopped in and am glad I did.
The pizza here is absolutely delicious and one of my new favorite spots now! We also had a really good pasta dish but the pizza is some of the best I've ever had.

Need a reservation for dinner--We had dinner on a Sat night, we arrived at 5:20pm. We have a little one, don't judge. :-) Anyway, they did get us seated but they were concerned because we did not have a reservation. I thought it was pretty early for them to be too busy and there was only 2 other tables taken at the time. They did begin to quickly fill up. I went ahead and gave 5 stars though because the food was really good and service was also once we were seated. Try the bruschetta, which is warm soft bread and melted cheese drizzled with balsamic-not the typical definition of bruschetta but really tasty. The pasta dishes are generous portions with really good marinara sauce. Pizza with good crust. We will be back with a reservation next time.

Hidden gem!! We tried this place last night for the first time and we really enjoyed it. It's tucked away in the air park so use your GPS. The staff was great and food was INCREDIBLE. It has a charming and quaint ambiance to it. Makes a great date night. We will certainly be regulars.

Excellent service and great food. Slightly hidden location a block off of Scottsdale but worth finding.  Only disappointment was that we didn't get to try Mama's Gravy.  Got there at 7 and they were already sold out.  Server and hostess and owners were all great and very attentive.  Reservations recommended. Great for anything from a casual dinner to a romantic dinner date.

Went last night my family. We have been there twice before a while back, I guess it is under new ownership. It was an awkward experience to say the least. They refused basic requests because they are trying to basically cut food costs. I heard the new owner tell the table next to us they couldn't substitute angel hair for linguini as their side pasta because they are trying to "streamline" the kitchen and staff. They had a couple basic requests as well that she refused and said to them "restaurants who do that shut down and I don't want to shut down". It was awkward to watch. A few mistakes from the server who was otherwise nice were also handled quite awkwardly. I just think the place used to be good but is having a hard time with chemistry and a new cheap owner. Place has gone downhill.
Great classic Italian food. I usually get either the gnocchi or cavatelli with rosa sauce and always leave with a smile on my face. They also have great slices of pizza at lunch.

First time I've ever ordered from this place.  Had it delivered by Grub Hub.  Either the driver got hungry on the way, or they really stiffed me on the meal.  11$ for barely any spaghetti.  If I'm spending that much money, I at least expect more food.  Here's an image of what I received. http://i.imgur.com/q6VklWn.jpg  Also garlic bread was a bit disappointing, but not a big deal.  Spaghetti wasn't bad. Not amazing, but it was good.  Update: While I haven't tried them again as of yet (I will), they did contact me and let me know that the delivery driver had spilled my food and apologized for the inconvenience.  They also refunded my order for the issue.  I'm very grateful for that.  I'll try their food again soon.

Amazing bread & oil that came out after being seated, yum.  Otherwise - nothing special about this place from my perspective all around.  Bruchetta was decent.  The chicken parmesan was the thinnest piece of breaded chicken I've ever had from a restaurant - a little rough and I wasn't a fan of the sauce.   We traded a 1/4 of our meals.  I'm a lasagna man, and man this was not for me.  Food had a slight petting zoo/goat aroma that I didn't care for.  I was disappointed based on its 4.5 rating that brought me in.   Lastly I mention this only because it's a first - the waiter took a phone call while taking our order (honestly I didn't care but some guests would have gone loco over that I'm sure!).  Note: the patio seats have a ledge on them that may not be very comfortable for someone that's a little taller than average.

We met another couple here, our first time  dining at NY's Best Italian Bistro and we were not disappointed.  We decided to sit outside since it was such a nice evening.  A few planes took off while we were there, which enhanced the ambience for us.  We Started with a small Caesar salad that was quite generous and delicious, followed by Calamari Fritti, Deb had Manicotti, our friends had Spaghetti.  All delicious. So NYBIB is a winner on three fronts, fun location, great service and delicious food; we'll be back!

The wife and I found this little tucked away spot on a Saturday evening. The service was just a little slow, but the staff took great care of us and the food was absolutely off the charts. People who know their Italian food frequent this place. We will certainly be going back. My comment about the service is probably an indicator that I'm always in a hurry. Our waiter treated us like family. If you are looking for some amazing Italian, this is the place.

Important - This restaurant has been bought by another local chain.  Times Square is the new owner. The phone number works for the new business.  The previous owner is not running this place.  I haven't been but they were nice.

What a find!!  I took my family to this place and everyone loved it.  The young teenager and a couple of adults, each with very different taste concerns.  All of us were very happy with the meal.    As a family we all poked around in each other's plates and we were all very pleased with all of it.  The young one had a pizza that everyone at the table loved.  One of us had the squash ravioli and that was probably the biggest hit of the night.  I am not usually a fan of oddly stuffed ravioli so I did not order it, but certainly would next time.  That was an amazing meal.    The deserts are also made on the premises from scratch.    The price for this meal was very reasonable.  Four of us ate for about $100 and we had deserts, coffee, beverages and sides.   This place is adjacent to the Scottsdale airport.  Off the beaten path.  Must try.

Most reviews refer to this as being tucked away...which it is.  The end of a runway.  With spectacular cuisine.  This rivals any Little Italy that you might find:  New York, the North End in Boston, Philly...  Try...everything.  Truly old world food that was spun in the kitchen of Italian masters.  The red sauces are light and fresh, the white sauces are a delight.  Pizza -- magnifico.  Strombolis -- like you are sitting on a bench in Venice.  Pasta -- imagine the hills of Tuscany falling away at your feet and the sun setting on the horizon.    Really, a wonderful find in the elbow of Scottsdale!

We recently had dinner here and as usual it rocks!  I had the veal parm and it was delicious and tender. The sauce is not sweet rather savory as I prefer.  My husband had the beef braciole.  He was not as impressed with the dish. We have had many of their specials in the past to include the pork Osso Buco and the stuffed Dover Sole.  Amazing!  The wine selection is good too.  It is however a bit pricey.  Most dishes average $20-$35.

I have worked nearby in the airpark for years now and have always wondered about this place. Finally one night while I was craving Italian food my husband remembered "that place we always pass by in the airpark" so I yelped it, saw the great reviews, and so we went.   We arrived a little before 6:00 on a Saturday night. The hostess greeted us and asked if we had reservations with a "I hope you have reservations" look (the place wasn't packed yet but it got to be quickly). We told her we didn't have reservations and she politely asked if we would be okay with the patio - this was not a problem. I would eat on the floor if they wanted me to - their food was amazing!  We started with homemade bread and the most delicious dipping oil EVER. We also had the Calamari Inferno, which was to DIE FOR. I had the Saturday Special, "Mama's Gravy" (it involved pork tenderloin wrapped around meatballs with rigatoni and authentic Italian sausage) and my husband had Eggplant Parmesan. I cannot put into words how delicious this place is, just GO. You won't regret it.   Prices were low, servings were generous, service was great (turns out the hostess was also our waitress and I think she was an owner / family as well), and the food can't be beat.   Its probably a good thing I didn't go to the restaurant during all these years of passing by it on my way home from work because I would be a total addict. Who am I kidding though - I will probably start getting takeout from here on my way home regularly :)
Great food, great people!

Loved this place! No frills here and great tasting dinner items. I ordered a pear and cheese pasta dish with balsamic drizzle.  AMAZING. The other dishes we ordered were fantastic.  Simple and very tasteful with affordable prices.  Will come back.

One of best Italian food I had in a long time. The first thing I noticed was the cleanliness of restaurant and Andrea Bocelli songs playing. Everything we ordered was excellent. This will be my go to Italian food. Our waiter was awesome too.

Started with the fried calamari, asked for the spicy marinara on the side. The sauce was absolutely delicious!! One of the best sauces out there, even better than the Italian restaurants in NYC.  Ended up ordering the Pescatore Pasta made Fra Diavlo style per my request. This dish was to die for. Sauce was spot on, seafood was perfectly cooked. Mussels, clams and shrimp. Yum! My only suggestion would be to remove the tail on the shrimp. I really dislike seeing the tail left on when it's in a pasta dish and everything is all mixed together.   Ended our meal with their cheesecake and cannoli.. Both were also amazing. Our server was on point. A little slow at greeting us but definitely redeemed himself with his top notch service.  I highly recommend this restaurant. If you are looking for delicious, authentic Italian cuisine - then this place is for you!

I'd give this place 0 stars but I had to mark something. We actually never did eat here but after walking in noticed the place didn't look very clean. Then we were given menus that were sticky.  We ordered sparkling water and I noticed that the glass they gave my husband was very smeared with fingerprints. So we told the waitress who inspected the glass as if we were lying, she then walked off with it. She returned with what we thought was a new glass. My husband went to take a drink from the glass and noted a bad smell so he asked the waitress again for another glass.  At that point a waiter also came to the table to check what was happening. The waitress told the waiter "I wiped the glass out with the blue rag". As if it should not be a problem At that point we said we were leaving and offered to pay for the water. Although they didn't accept money for the water the waiter did say "Sorry we weren't up to your expectations". We will never return.

I've been here multiple times and we've also had take out a few different nights. The quality of the food and the service just keeps being amazing. It almost feels too good to be true- like something will give at some point...but it never does.   Each time we eat there, we like to hit the patio to watch the planes, otherwise you definitely need a reservation. The flavors, the quality of the ingredients and the creativity of the dishes make this place shine. Try it all- it's all good. And if there are still specials available that evening, order them! If they bottled their marinara, I'd buy it.   I used to think I wasn't that into Italian food and then I ate here and realized I'd just been settling for poor quality/cheesy/greasy grossness that was labeled Italian. Eat here; it will change your definition of good Italian food.

Really looking forward to eating here as the reviews and some friends said it was great.  Perhaps we went on a bad day, but it took almost an hour for our main meal to come out after we ordered it.  Way too long.  Our food was not cold, but not as warm as I would like.  Perhaps the waiter was not too attentive to bringing our meal when the kitchen had it ready.  Our waiter rarely visited our table and we had to ask another server for help occasionally.  The don't have a lot of wine by the glass, just by the bottle so I was disappointed in their selections.  I ordered the seafood carbonara, and while it tasted excellent, there was a total of 3 shrimp and two scallops.  Not a lot for almost $23.00.  I was quite disappointed.  Atmosphere was not terrible.  About what I would have expected.  Will I be back?  I don't know.  I might give them another chance but I wanted to report on my first experience there.  Thank you.

I very much enjoyed dinner at NY's Best Italian Bistro this weekend. It's a cute little place tucked away on 73rd street with plenty of parking which is a plus in my book.   By Scottsdale standards, it's not a "fancy" or "upscale" restaurant per se, but it can't be considered a dive either. It's moderately nice from a décor perspective.  My date and I were seated toward the door and my biggest complaint would be that the table was very, very small and cramped. I had to put my purse under the table on the floor.  I asked for bread and they brought us a huge serving of warm, soft, delicious Italian bread. Very yeast-y (not sure that's a real word but let's go with it) tasting and fresh- came with olive oil for dipping. Really enjoyable!  I had an absolutely stellar glass of moscato too!  My date ordered the shrimp scampi and was pleased with the taste and the fact that it was a huge serving of food. I didn't sample it, but the shrimp were big & juicy and it looked awesome.  I ordered the eggplant parmesan and it was hands down the best I've ever had. It was cooked & seasoned well and there was a generous helping of melted mozzarella cheese atop the eggplant. The best way to my heart is to not be skimpy with the cheese- yay! The serving of spaghetti that came with the eggplant wasn't as al-dente as I usually prefer, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.  We were too stuffed to order dessert but they do have cannoli on the menu (a personal fave of mine) and I *will* be back to try it!

Joint is off the hook!!  We ended up finding this place on yelp actually and by far the best spot we found in AZ while on vacation.  It's definitely tucked away in an industrial business area but what a gem!!  It's family run with the majority of the employees from NY.  Has a warm Soprano type of feel inside but totally inviting!!  Delicious food, great hospitality and for a great price.  Just thinking about the calamari is making me salivate as we speak... We had soup, pasta, salad and the focaccia bread is outstanding.  And can I just say homemade cannolis??  OMG...FABULOUS!!  We ate here at least twice in 1 week and it hit the spot each time.  I wish they had a bay area location..This place is a must when in AZ.

Well I'm sure everyone knows it's time to update my review since the original chef is back along with all the favorites. I was there in early May and it's back on track. Not that things were that bad but I think people have a level of expectation and that's where the loyalty comes in. That being said, I'd wholeheartedly recommend this fabulous place again--it remains a little known gem and the one place my friends and family request to go when they are all in town.

First time here and will definitely return. If you like warm familia atmosphere, delicious light Italian food (I noted more hearty options too), and a casual clientele/neighborhood restaurant feel, you may love this place as we did. Reminiscent of Italian places I grew up with in Northern  Indiana. Specifically,  the pasta is fresh, the sauce is slow simmered, and the menu offers several options. The complementary bread is light and fresh and worth the visit. Located adjacent to the Scottsdale airport. All in all, it's  a winner if you relate to what I've written  so far.

This is a sad day.  I have eaten my last meal at New York's Best Italian. This has been my go to place for years and it WAS an outstanding restaurant.  The New owner, new chief, new menu have destroyed an iconic restaurant.  I will not be back!
